name: Test File Organization Check
description: Prevents test files from being added to the root directory and ensures proper test organization
script:
#!/bin/bash

# Check for test files in root directory
echo "üîç Checking for test files in root directory..."

# Check for test_*.py files in root
if ls test_*.py 2>/dev/null; then
    echo "‚ùå ERROR: Test files found in root directory!"
    echo "   Test files should be in the tests/ directory."
    echo "   Please move these files to tests/ directory:"
    ls test_*.py 2>/dev/null | sed 's/^/   - /'
    exit 1
fi

# Check for test directories in root (excluding tests/)
test_dirs=("test_*" "*_test" "*_tests")
found_dirs=()

for pattern in "${test_dirs[@]}"; do
    for dir in $pattern; do
        if [[ -d "$dir" && "$dir" != "tests" ]]; then
            found_dirs+=("$dir")
        fi
    done
done

if [[ ${#found_dirs[@]} -gt 0 ]]; then
    echo "‚ùå ERROR: Test directories found in root!"
    echo "   Test directories should be under tests/ directory."
    echo "   Please move or remove these directories:"
    printf '   - %s\n' "${found_dirs[@]}"
    exit 1
fi

# Check for test runner scripts in wrong location
if [[ -f "scripts/run_tests.py" ]]; then
    echo "‚ùå ERROR: Test runner script found in scripts/ directory!"
    echo "   Test runner should be in tests/ directory."
    echo "   Please move scripts/run_tests.py to tests/run_tests.py"
    exit 1
fi

echo "‚úÖ Test file organization check passed!"
exit 0
